title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: centrimpact R package provides comprehensive toolkit analyzing visualizing community engaged research metrics highlighted CEnTR*IMPACT framework (Price, 2024). offers specialized functions researcher-partner alignment, project dynamics, cascade effects, creating publication-ready visualizations. Based CENTR*IMPACT framework, package quantifies following critical concepts community engaged research: Alignment: shared vision researchers partners (SaS_a). Cascade Effects: ripple effect work direct participants third degree separation (ScS_c). Dynamics: Ways project carried modeled CBPR framework (SdS_d). Indicators: “Traditional” markers academic productivity, individuals served, number outputs, etc.

title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: can install review version centrimpact GitHub :
code: # Install devtools if not already installed if (!require("devtools")) install.packages("devtools")  # Install centrimpact devtools::install_github("CENTR-IMPACT/centrimpact-review")

title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: Alignment Score (SaS_a) quantifies degree consensus researchers partners across key project areas Goals, Values, Roles, Resources. Project Alignment can visualized either Slopegraph Abacus Plot.
code: library(centrimpact)  # Generate example data alignment_data <- generate_alignment_data()  # Analyze alignment data alignment_results <- analyze_alignment(alignment_data)  # Visualize results with a Slopegraph plot_slopegraph <- visualize_alignment(alignment_results)  # Visualize results with an Abacus Plot plot_abacus <- visualize_abacus(alignment_results)

title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: Cascade Effects Score (ScS_c) quantifies degree information power distributed core participants across three degrees. analysis based social network analysis principles. Cascade Effects can visualized radial bar chart “racetrack plot.”
code: library(centrimpact)  # Generate example data cascade_data <- generate_cascade_data()  # Analyze alignment data cascade_results <- analyze_cascade(cascade_data)  # Visualize results plot_cascade <- visualize_cascade(cascade_results)

title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: Project Dynamics Score (SdS_d) quantifies degree various aspects community engaged research project outlined Community Based Participatory Research framework (Wallerstein & Duran, 2010; Wallerstein et al., 2020). Project Dynamics can visualized rose chart.
code: library(centrimpact)  # Generate example data dynamics_data <- generate_dynamics_data()  # Analyze alignment data dynamics_results <- analyze_dynamics(dynamics_data)  # Visualize results plot_dynamics <- visualize_dynamics(dynamics_results)

title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: Project Indicators traditional academic indicators individuals served, outputs generated, outcomes met, etc. provide typical “many” metrics often reported faculty reviews final reports. Project Indicators can visualized horizontal bubble chart. separate analysis function needed direct counts.
code: library(centrimpact)  # Generate example data indicators_data <- generate_indicators_data()  # Visualize results plot_indicators <- visualize_indicators(indicators_data)

title: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics
text: visualizations created centrimpact return ggplot2 objects. allows customization (colors, fonts, etc.) using standard ggplot2 functions.

title: Calculate Alignment Scores — analyze_alignment
text: Performs comprehensive analysis alignment "researcher" "partner" ratings using CEnTR*IMPACT methodology. function calculates Intraclass Correlation Coefficient (ICC) derive Alignment Score (\(S_a\)), alongside descriptive statistics (interpolated medians ranges) visualize gap perspectives.

title: Calculate Alignment Scores — analyze_alignment
code: analyze_alignment(alignment_df)

title: Calculate Alignment Scores — analyze_alignment
text: alignment_df data frame containing raw survey responses. Must contain: role: Character ('researcher' 'partner'). alignment: Character (factor/category rated). rating: Numeric (rating provided, typically 0-1).

title: Calculate Alignment Scores — analyze_alignment
text: object class alignment_analysis containing: table: Wide-format data frame interpolated medians. plot_data: Long-format data frame suitable ggplot2. icc: full ICC object irr package. alignment_score: numeric ICC value (\(S_a\)).

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
text: Performs comprehensive analysis network's "Cascade" structure measure localized influence. Based theory direct personal influence typically extends "three degrees impact" (Christakis & Fowler, 2009), function examines potential cascading effects across layers using formula: $$= \gamma (\alpha L + \beta G) + \lambda T$$

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
code: analyze_cascade(network_df, alpha_parameter = 0.9)

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
text: network_df data frame representing edge list. Required columns: : Source node identifier. : Target node identifier. layer: Integer (1-4). "degree" interaction (1 = Core, 2 = Partners, 3 = Community, 4 = Distant). alpha_parameter Numeric. Damping factor Alpha Centrality (defaults 0.9).

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
text: object class cascade_analysis containing: cascade_score: global Balance Score (\(S_c\), 0-1). summary: summary table aggregating roles Layer (Degree). node_data: Detailed metrics every node. topology_score: Baseline topological health score.

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
text: Theoretical Foundation: Unlike general connectivity metrics, method resembles work Long, Cunningham, Braithwaite (2013), examining participants' roles based structure network formed research. assesses influence ripples outward core team (Layer 1) broader community (Layer 3+). Operational Definitions: function maps Social Network Analysis (SNA) metrics four key influence roles: 1. Knitting (Cohesion & Bonding): Measures well network strengthens internal bonds within specific group. Metrics: Community detection (Walktrap) + Eigenvector Centrality. Interpretation: High scores indicate tight-knit, resilient core. 2. Bridging (Connection & Spanning): Measures ability connect otherwise disconnected groups (filling "structural holes"). Metrics: Structural Holes (Constraint) + Betweenness Centrality. Interpretation: High scores indicate key "brokers" connecting silos. 3. Channeling (Flow & Transmission): Measures efficiency information flow resource distribution. Metrics: Local Betweenness + Alpha Centrality. Interpretation: High scores indicate effective pipelines moving resources. 4. Reaching (Access & Inclusion): Measures extent network's periphery accessibility. Metrics: Clustering Coefficient + Harmonic Centrality. Interpretation: High scores indicate inclusive network reduced barriers. Cascade Score Interpretation: "Cascade Balance Score" (\(S_c\)) calculated using inverse Gini coefficient layer-level scores determine influence effectively distributed across "three degrees" concentrated top. \(S_c < 0.50\): Low Balance (Core-dominated) \(0.50 \le S_c < 0.59\): Low Balance \(0.60 \le S_c < 0.69\): Moderate Balance \(0.70 \le S_c \le 0.79\): High Balance \(S_c \ge 0.80\): High Balance (Equitable distribution)

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
text: Christakis, N. ., & Fowler, J. H. (2009). Connected: Surprising Power Social Networks Shape Lives. Little, Brown Spark. Haddad, C. N., et al. (2024). World Bank's New Inequality Indicator. World Bank. doi:10.1596/41687 Long, J. C., Cunningham, F. C., & Braithwaite, J. (2013). Bridges, brokers boundary spanners collaborative networks: systematic review. BMC Health Services Research, 13, 158. doi:10.1186/1472-6963-13-158 Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation. CUMU. Wang, H.-Y., et al. (2020). Comparison Ferguson’s delta Gini coefficient used measuring inequality data. Health Quality Life Outcomes, 18(1), 111.

title: Analyze Project Cascade Effects — analyze_cascade
code: # 1. Generate a synthetic 3-layer network # This simulates Core (L1) -> Partner (L2) -> Community (L3) flow network_data <- generate_cascade_data(seed = 42)  # 2. Run the cascade analysis result <- analyze_cascade(network_data)  # 3. Inspect the Global Balance Score (Sd) # A high score (0.8+) implies influence is well-distributed across layers print(result$cascade_score) #> [1] 0.6595395  # 4. View the Layer Summary # Check if "Knitting" is high in Layer 1 vs "Reaching" in Layer 3 print(result$summary) #> # A tibble: 3 × 9 #>   layer count gamma layer_knitting layer_bridging layer_channeling #>   <dbl> <int> <dbl>          <dbl>          <dbl>            <dbl> #> 1     1     3  0.9           0.802          0.823           0.796  #> 2     2     3  0.5           0.783          0.610           0.387  #> 3     3     7  0.45          0.365          0               0.0515 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: layer_reaching <dbl>, layer_score <dbl>, #> #   layer_number <chr>

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
text: Implements "Dynamics" component CEnTR*IMPACT framework (Price, 2024). function processes multidimensional assessment data calculate domain-level scores using geometric means computes "Balance Score" (\(S_d\)) using Gini coefficient. designed measure equitable distribution effort impact across core domains CBPR Framework (Wallerstein & Duran, 2010; Wallerstein, et al., 2020).

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
code: analyze_dynamics(dynamics_df)

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
text: dynamics_df data frame containing assessment data. Required columns: domain: Character Factor. broader category (e.g., "Partnerships"). dimension: Character Factor. specific metric (e.g., "Trust"). salience: Numeric. importance dimension. Must \(0 < x \le 1\). weight: Numeric. observed intensity presence. Must \(0 < x \le 1\).

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
text: object class dynamics_analysis containing: dynamics_df: processed input data frame added dimension_score. domain_df: summary data frame aggregated scores per domain. dynamics_score: single numeric value representing Balance Score (\(S_d\)), 1 indicates perfect balance.

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
text: CEnTR*IMPACT framework uses analysis quantify "Developmental Balance." higher Balance Score indicates project maintaining healthy equilibrium across various dimensions, rather -indexing just one area expense others. Scoring Process: Dimension Scoring: Calculated geometric mean weight salience. \(Score_{dim} = \sqrt{Weight \times Salience}\) Domain Scoring: Aggregates dimension scores within domain using geometric mean. Dynamics Scoring: Calculated based inequality domain scores. \(S_d = 1 - Gini(Score_{domains})\) Dynamics Score Interpretation: following rule thumb (Haddad et al., 2024; Wang et al., 2020) used interpret Dynamics Score (\(S_d\)): \(S_d < 0.5\): Low Balance \(0.50 \le S_d < 0.59\): Low Balance \(0.60 \le S_d < 0.69\): Moderate Balance \(0.70 \le S_d \le 0.79\): High Balance \(S_d \ge 0.80\): High Balance Handling Missing Data: function permissive partial datasets. domain included input contains NA values weights salience, retained output. However, sufficient data missing prevent calculation, score NaN.

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
text: Haddad, C. N., Mahler, D. G., Diaz-Bonilla, C., Hill, R., Lakner, C., & Lara Ibarra, G. (2024). World Bank's New Inequality Indicator: Number Countries High Inequality. Washington, DC: World Bank. doi:10.1596/41687 Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation (CUMU-Collaboratory Fellowship Report). Coalition Urban Metropolitan Universities. Wallerstein, N., & Duran, B. (2010). Community-Based Participatory Research Contributions Intervention Research: Intersection Science Practice Improve Health Equity. American Journal Public Health, 100(S1), S40–S46. doi:10.2105/AJPH.2009.184036 Wallerstein, N., et al. (2020). Engage Equity: Long-Term Study Community-Based Participatory Research Community-Engaged Research Practices Outcomes. Health Education & Behavior, 47(3), 380–390. doi:10.1177/1090198119897075 Wang, H.-Y., Chou, W., Shao, Y., & Chien, T.-W. (2020). Comparison Ferguson’s delta Gini coefficient used measuring inequality data related health quality life outcomes. Health Quality Life Outcomes, 18(1), 111. doi:10.1186/s12955-020-01356-6

title: Analyze Project Dynamics — analyze_dynamics
code: # 1. Generate synthetic data using the built-in generator # We use a fixed seed to ensure the example is reproducible df <- generate_dynamics_data(seed = 123)  # 2. Run the Dynamics analysis result <- analyze_dynamics(df)  # 3. Inspect the global Balance Score (Sd) # A score closer to 1.0 indicates high balance across domains print(result$dynamics_score) #> [1] 0.9763636  # 4. Inspect the domain-level scores print(result$domain_df) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   domain       domain_score #>   <ord>               <dbl> #> 1 Contexts             0.45 #> 2 Partnerships         0.45 #> 3 Research             0.44 #> 4 Learning             0.46 #> 5 Outcomes             0.4   # 5. Example with high-variance data (to show lower balance) df_unbalanced <- generate_dynamics_data(seed = 123, domain_variance = TRUE) result_unbalanced <- analyze_dynamics(df_unbalanced) print(result_unbalanced$dynamics_score) #> [1] 0.9291139

title: centrimpact: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics — centrimpact-package
text: `centrimpact` R package provides comprehensive toolkit analyzing visualizing community engaged research metrics highlighted CEnTR*IMPACT framework. offers specialized functions researcher-partner alignment, project dynamics, cascade effects, creating publication-ready visualizations.

title: centrimpact: Supporting the Analysis and Visualization of Community Engaged Research Metrics — centrimpact-package
text: Maintainer: Jeremy Forest Price jfprice@iu.edu (ORCID)

title: Generate Alignment Data — generate_alignment_data
text: Generates synthetic data simulate "Alignment"—degree agreement different stakeholders (Researchers Partners) across key project areas.

code: generate_alignment_data(seed = Sys.time())

title: Generate Alignment Data — generate_alignment_data
text: seed Integer POSIXct. seed random number generation. Defaults Sys.time().

title: Generate Alignment Data — generate_alignment_data
text: data frame columns: alignment, role, rating.

title: Generate Alignment Data — generate_alignment_data
text: function simulates survey response dataset multiple participants (Researchers Partners) rate agreement alignment various axes (Goals, Values, Roles, etc.). Logic: Randomly selects number researchers (1-10) partners (Researcher Count + 1 15). Generates alignment ratings (0.36 1.00) 8 categories. Useful visualizing gaps understanding expectation stakeholder groups.

title: Generate Alignment Data — generate_alignment_data
text: Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation (CUMU-Collaboratory Fellowship Report). Coalition Urban Metropolitan Universities.

title: Generate Cascade Data — generate_cascade_data
text: Generates synthetic network data simulate multi-layered network showing impact diffuses primary agents (Layer 1) secondary (Layer 2) tertiary (Layer 3) actors.

title: Generate Cascade Data — generate_cascade_data
code: generate_cascade_data(seed = Sys.time())

title: Generate Cascade Data — generate_cascade_data
text: seed Integer POSIXct. seed random number generation. Defaults Sys.time().

title: Generate Cascade Data — generate_cascade_data
text: data frame representing edge list columns: , , layer.

title: Generate Cascade Data — generate_cascade_data
text: function constructs directed graph structure (represented edge list) three distinct layers. uses optimized, vectorized approach generate connections based probabilistic rules defined CEnTR*IMPACT framework. Network Logic: Layer 1: fully connected clique primary agents (3-10 nodes). Layer 2: Children Layer 1 (1-3 children per parent). 36% chance internal connections. Layer 3: Children Layer 2 (parents selected 72% probability). 10% chance internal connections.

title: Generate Cascade Data — generate_cascade_data
text: Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation (CUMU-Collaboratory Fellowship Report). Coalition Urban Metropolitan Universities.

title: Generate Project Dynamics Data — generate_dynamics_data
text: Generates synthetic data simulate "Dynamics" collaborative project—specifically Developmental Balance—defined CEnTR*IMPACT framework (Price, 2024).

title: Generate Project Dynamics Data — generate_dynamics_data
code: generate_dynamics_data(   seed = Sys.time(),   exclude = NULL,   na_prob = 0.05,   weight_set = c(0.78, 0.84, 0.9, 0.95, 1),   domain_variance = FALSE )

title: Generate Project Dynamics Data — generate_dynamics_data
text: seed Integer POSIXct. seed random number generation ensure reproducibility. Defaults Sys.time(). exclude Character vector. list Domain names exclude dataset (e.g., c("Contexts")). na_prob Numeric. probability (0 1) weight value replaced NA. Defaults 0.05. weight_set Numeric vector. pool numbers weights sampled. Defaults c(0.78, 0.84, 0.90, 0.95, 1.00). domain_variance Logical. TRUE, introduces strong bias per Domain ensure averages differ significantly. Defaults FALSE.

title: Generate Project Dynamics Data — generate_dynamics_data
text: data frame columns: domain: framework domain. dimension: specific dimension within domain. salience: randomly assigned importance score (0.2 1.0). weight: sampled intensity score based weight_set.

title: Generate Project Dynamics Data — generate_dynamics_data
text: Controlling Variance: domain_variance = TRUE, function applies Hyper-Polarized Sampling. forces Domain choose "performance tier" (Low, High, Mixed) specific probabilities (Low: 45%, High: 45%, Mixed: 10%). Low Tier: Samples weights bottom 2 values provided weight_set. High Tier: Samples weights top 2 values provided weight_set. maximizes mathematical spread domains, making useful testing sensitivity visualizing inequality Dynamics scoring. Schema Structure: function uses hardcoded schema representing 5 core domains framework: Contexts (4 dimensions) Partnerships (4 dimensions) Research (5 dimensions) Learning (4 dimensions) Outcomes (4 dimensions)

title: Generate Project Dynamics Data — generate_dynamics_data
code: # 1. Generate standard data df_std <- generate_dynamics_data(seed = 123)  # 2. Generate "Unbalanced" data (High Variance) # This is useful for testing low Balance Scores (Sd) df_var <- generate_dynamics_data(seed = 123, domain_variance = TRUE)  # 3. Generate data with custom weights and no missing values df_custom <- generate_dynamics_data(   na_prob = 0,   weight_set = c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9) )

title: Visualize Researcher-Partner Alignment (Abacus Plot) — visualize_abacus
text: Creates "Single Rail Abacus" plot visualize alignment. method places "beads" (representing ratings) onto category "rails," providing clear view central tendency divergence linear scale.

title: Visualize Researcher-Partner Alignment (Abacus Plot) — visualize_abacus
code: visualize_abacus(   analysis_object,   project_title = "Project Alignment Visualization",   point_size = 5 )

title: Visualize Researcher-Partner Alignment (Abacus Plot) — visualize_abacus
text: analysis_object object class alignment_analysis produced analyze_alignment. project_title String. title plot. Defaults "Project Alignment Visualization". point_size Numeric. size main median bead. Defaults 5.

title: Visualize Researcher-Partner Alignment (Abacus Plot) — visualize_abacus
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Visualize Researcher-Partner Alignment (Abacus Plot) — visualize_abacus
text: Methodology: Inspired "Degree Collaboration Tool" (Doberneck & Dann, 2019), visualization maps multiple dimensions project onto horizontal tracks (0 1). adapted CEnTR*IMPACT framework (Price, 2024) show consensus spread survey ratings. Visual Elements: Rails: Horizontal gray bars representing full continuum possible agreement (0 1). Solid Beads: median rating group (Researchers vs. Partners). Transparent Beads: minimum maximum ratings, showing spread disagreement within group. Overall Square: geometric mean (consensus) rating. format particularly useful identifying "outliers" (individuals rated extremely high low) relative group's median.

title: Visualize Researcher-Partner Alignment (Abacus Plot) — visualize_abacus
text: Doberneck, D. M., & Dann, S. L. (2019). Degree Collaboration Tool. Engagement Scholarship. Available : https://engagementscholarship.org/upload/eesw/2022/2-5%20%20Doberneck%20_%20Dann%20(2019)%20The%20Degree%20of%20Collaboration%20Tool.pdf Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation. CUMU. Available : https://cumuonline.org/wp-content/uploads/2024-CUMU-Collaboratory-Fellowship-Report.pdf

Create the abacus visualization p <- visualize_abacus(results, project_title = "Partnership Alignment")  # 3. Display the plot print(p) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

title: Visualize Rater Alignment (Slopegraph) — visualize_alignment
text: ggplot2 object can customized (e.g., adding themes changing labels).

title: Visualize Rater Alignment (Slopegraph) — visualize_alignment
text: Methodology: slopegraph, introduced Edward Tufte (1983), preferred method comparing gradients change difference two distinct states (case, two distinct stakeholder roles). Interpretation: Flat Lines: Indicate perfect alignment (Partners Researchers agree rating). Steep Slopes: Indicate divergence (One group values factor significantly higher ). Crossing Lines: Indicate difference priority ranking (e.g., Partners rate "Goals" highest, Researchers rate lowest). plot includes Alignment Score (\(S_a\)) subtitle, providing quick summary statistic alongside visual detail.

title: Visualize Rater Alignment (Slopegraph) — visualize_alignment
text: Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation. CUMU. Tufte, E. R. (1983). Visual Display Quantitative Information. Graphics Press.

Create the visualization p <- visualize_alignment(results, project_title = "Year 1 Alignment")  # 3. Display the plot print(p) #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_text_repel()`).

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
text: Visualizes "Cascade" effects—specifically reach project across different degrees impact (1st Degree, 2nd Degree, 3rd Degree)—using radial bar chart inspired sociological infographics W.E.B. Du Bois.

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
code: visualize_cascade(   analysis_object,   project_title = "Project Cascade Effects Visualization",   score_label_color = "white" )

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
text: analysis_object object class cascade_analysis. project_title String. title plot. Defaults "Project Cascade Effects Visualization". score_label_color String. Color code text labels inside bars. Defaults "white".

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
text: Historical Context: often called "racetrack plot" modern plotting libraries, visualization style pays homage "City Rural Population 1890" spiral charts created W.E.B. Du Bois 1900 Paris Exposition. Du Bois effectively used wrapped bars display magnitude within confined space, allowing immediate visual comparison lengths (impact) without distortions standard pie charts. Interpretation: plot maps "Ripple Effect" project: Inner Ring (1st Degree: Immediate impact (Direct participants). Middle Ring (2nd Degree): Intermediate impact (Partners partners, local community). Outer Ring (3rd Degree): Distant impact (Policy changes, broader field adoption). length arc represents score (0 1). "full" track indicates maximum impact level.

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
text: Du Bois, W. E. B. (1900). Georgia Negro: Social Study. (Infographics displayed Paris Exposition 1900). Library Congress. Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation. CUMU.

title: Visualize Cascade (Ripple) Effects — visualize_cascade
code: # 1. Generate and analyze data data <- generate_cascade_data() results <- analyze_cascade(data)  # 2. Create the default visualization p <- visualize_cascade(results)  # 3. Customize the palette using standard ggplot2 grammar # e.g., p + ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Dark2") print(p)

title: Visualize Dynamics (Rose Diagram) — visualize_dynamics
text: Creates "Rose" "Coxcomb" chart visualize developmental balance project. Inspired Florence Nightingale's historic diagrams, plot wraps bar chart around central point, allowing comparison cyclical categorized data without visual bias linear rank.

title: Visualize Dynamics (Rose Diagram) — visualize_dynamics
code: visualize_dynamics(   analysis_object,   project_title = "Project Dynamics Visualization" )

title: Visualize Dynamics (Rose Diagram) — visualize_dynamics
text: analysis_object object class dynamics_analysis. list must contain: dynamics_df: data frame columns domain, dimension, domain_score, dimension_value. dynamics_score: single numeric value representing overall system score (\(S_d\)). project_title String. title plot. Defaults "Project Dynamics Visualization".

title: Visualize Dynamics (Rose Diagram) — visualize_dynamics
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Visualize Dynamics (Rose Diagram) — visualize_dynamics
text: Historical Context: visualization adapted "Diagram Causes Mortality Army East" Florence Nightingale (1858). Just diagram highlighted disproportionate causes death, chart highlights disproportionate strengths weaknesses project infrastructure. Visual Metaphor: chart separates data two distinct layers show "Forest" (Domain) "Trees" (Dimensions): Petals (Background Wedges): Represent aggregated Domain score. form background "fan." Domain strong, petal reaches outer edge (1.0). weak, shrinks toward center. Stamen (Foreground Lollipops): Represent specific Dimension values. radiating lines allow see specific dimension (e.g., "Trust") lagging behind parent Domain (e.g., "Partnerships"). Interpretation: well-balanced project appear full, nearly circular bloom. Gaps "wilted" sectors indicate areas project infrastructure (Context, Partnerships, Research, Learning, Outcomes) require attention.

title: Visualize Dynamics (Rose Diagram) — visualize_dynamics
text: Nightingale, F. (1858). Notes Matters Affecting Health, Efficiency, Hospital Administration British Army. Harrison Sons. Price, J. F. (2024). CEnTR*IMPACT: Community Engaged Transformative Research – Inclusive Measurement Projects & Community Transformation. CUMU.

title: Visualize Project Indicators — visualize_indicators
text: Creates linear "Bubble Chart" display key project metrics. indicator represented circle sized relative value, set fixed background ring.

title: Visualize Project Indicators — visualize_indicators
code: visualize_indicators(   indicator_data = NULL,   project_title = "Project Indicators Visualization" )

title: Visualize Project Indicators — visualize_indicators
text: indicator_data data frame columns: indicator: Character strings (e.g., "Community Partners"). value: Numeric values. NULL, random demo data generated. project_title String. title plot.

title: Visualize Project Indicators — visualize_indicators
text: ggplot2 object.
